drawnet.lib.ddl
Class Model

java.lang.Object
  drawnet.lib.ddl.Model
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Manages a Model structure.

See Also:
ElementInstance, PlaneDimension

Constructor Detail

Model

public Model(java.lang.String mainId,
             Formalism f)
Creates a new model. It creates the "_root" element and adds the main element.

Parameters:
mainId - the name of the main element of the newly created model
f - the model's formalism

Model

public Model(Formalism f)
Creates a new model. It creates the "_root" element but don't add the main element.

Parameters:
f - the model's formalism

setConstraintMode

public void setConstraintMode(int m)
Sets the mode to use for constraint checking.

Parameters:
m - mode to assign. Valid values are:
  • OVERRIDE (default) -> don't check constraints
  • CHECK_AND_DO -> check constraints and execute if possible
  • CHECK_ONLY -> check only, without executing

getConstraintMode

public int getConstraintMode()
Gets the currently used mode for constraint checking.

Returns:
the current mode
See Also:
setConstraintMode(int)

checkRuntimeConstraints

public boolean checkRuntimeConstraints()
Checks the models' runtime constraints (starting from the main element).

Returns:
true if ok, false if some constraint is violated

checkModelConstraints

public boolean checkModelConstraints()
Checks the models' model constraints (starting from the main element).

Returns:
true if ok, false if some constraint is violated

addSubElement

public boolean addSubElement(java.lang.String id,
                             ElementType elemType,
                             boolean makeDefault)
Adds a new sub-element to the model. The element is placed directly under the main element. Warning: the ElementType provided MUST be taken from model's formalism, otherwise it cannot be added. This is needed for typechecking purposes.

Parameters:
id - the name of the new element
elemType - the type of the new element
makeDefault - a boolean to tell the constructor to build the default element instance or not. Useful if you are loading from file and don't want to make elements that are not described in the file itself
Returns:
true if ok, false otherwise, sets error accordingly

addSubElement

public boolean addSubElement(ElementInstance e)
Adds a sub-element to the model. The element is placed directly under the main element. Warning: the ElementType of the ElementInstance to add MUST be taken from model's formalism, otherwise it cannot be abbed. This is needed for typechecking purposes.

Parameters:
e - the element to add
Returns:
true if ok, false otherwise, sets error accordingly

addSubElement

public boolean addSubElement(java.lang.String id,
                             ElementType elemType,
                             ElementInstance mountPoint,
                             boolean makeDefault)
Adds a new sub-element to an existing element Warning: the ElementType provided MUST be taken from model's formalism, otherwise it cannot be abbed. This is needed for typechecking purposes.

Parameters:
id - id of the new element to build and add
elemType - the type of the new element
mountPoint - element to add to
makeDefault - a boolean to tell the constructor to build the default element instance or not. Useful if you are loading from file and don't want to make elements that are not described in the file itself
Returns:
true if ok, false otherwise, sets error accordingly

                             ElementInstance mountPoint)

Parameters:
e - element to add
mountPoint - element to add to
Returns:
true if ok, false otherwise, sets error accordingly

addSubElement

public boolean addSubElement(java.lang.String id,
                             ElementType elemType,
                             java.lang.String mountPointId,
                             boolean makeDefault)
Adds a new sub-element to an existing element of the model. Warning: the ElementType provided MUST be taken from model's formalism, otherwise it cannot be added. This is needed for typechecking purposes.

Parameters:
id - id of the new element
elemType - the type of the new element
mountPointId - id of the element to add to
makeDefault - a boolean to tell the constructor to build the default element instance or not. Useful if you are loading from file and don't want to make elements that are not described in the file itself
Returns:
true if ok, false otherwise, sets error accordingly

addSubElement

public boolean addSubElement(ElementInstance e,
                             java.lang.String mountPointId)
Adds a sub-element to an existing element of the model. Warning: the ElementType of the ElementInstance to add MUST be taken from model's formalism, otherwise it cannot be added. This happens for typechecking purposes.

Parameters:
e - element to add
mountPointId - id of the element to add to
Returns:
true if ok, false otherwise, sets error accordingly

getSubElement

public ElementInstance getSubElement(java.lang.String id)
Gets a sub-element of the main. It uses the model's current dimension value to retrieve the instance.

Parameters:
id - id of the element to retrieve
Returns:
the element or null if it not exists, sets error accordingly

Returns:
the element or null if it not exists, sets error accordingly

getSubElementByPath

public ElementInstance getSubElementByPath(java.lang.String path)
Gets a sub-element given its path, starting from the main instance. It uses the model's current dimension value to retrieve the instance.

Parameters:
path - path of the element
Returns:
the element or null if not existing, sets error accordingly
Since:
2005.10.07 (by Marco Gribaudo)

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
                       throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
Clones a model. It makes a deep-clone.

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a perfect copy of the model
Throws:
java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
